intro: Liberbaileya, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Liberbaileya is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
